name.fi: Design for Social Change - Participation, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Design for Social Change - Participation, Föreläsning
name.en: Design for Social Change - Participation, Lecture

workload.en:
Overall workload 6 cr = 162 hrs:
  • Lectures, in-class discussions and in-class work with tutoring: 98 h
  • Independent studying: 25h
  • Personal reflection: 22h
  • Course evaluation: 1h

prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: COID students must have completed UID; CS students equivalent e.g. Techniques and methods of participation

learningOutcomes.en:
After successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
  • understand how codesign can facilitate social change in different socio-techno-economic settings;
  • critically assess potentials and pitfalls of different strategies to social change in particular contexts;
  • plan projects so that the merits and downsides of different ways, combinations, intensities and resources for fostering change are adequately addressed;
  • assess potentials and pitfalls of different approaches to codesign for social change.

content.en:
The course provides students with basic understanding and competences to build design projects aimed towards social change through codesign arrangements. The course has two key themes:
  1. Theories and key concepts of social change (Predominantly week one, but deepened across the course) provides a selective overview of most design relevant research on what it takes to achieve significant social change. DSC provides basics of core concepts, including sociotechnical systems, path dependence and path creation, sociotechnical couplings and interdependencies, practice change, activist and post-capitalist frameworks, policy issues and economic drivers. These resources are key to understanding what is involved in social change, particularly sociotechnical change, which is typically the type of social change where design is involved.
  2. Collaborative design for social change: collaborative design – extending design from professionals to impacted peoples and relevant stakeholders – is often a prerequisite for fostering social change. The interests, resources, legitimacy and enthusiasm of these people need to be met for a change initiative to have a chance to succeed. This is very difficult for designers to approximate these in their studio alone. DSC features a set of hands-on exercises and associated learning materials on key aspects of planning and running different types of collaborative design in different settings. Successful design collaboration requires analyzing the big picture contexts and working from there to the nitty gritty details of designing for collaboration (… and back again). The student groups use these learning to devise a plan for use (or non-use) of collaborative design as part of their extended project brief and, if practicable, also enact some of the planned actions.

assesmentMethods.en: Group assignments 70% – 100% active attendance, of which 20% can be covered with additional assignments. Individual literature assessment 30%

workload.en:
Total workload 9 credits = 243 h. 80% attendance is required.
  • 54 h Contact teaching: lectures, seminars, tutoring, excursions, and evaluation
  • 140 h Independent work: studio work, learning log
  • 48 h Personal reflection
  • 1 h Course evaluation

prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Completed Bachelor's degree. Previous experience in ceramics is recommended.

learningOutcomes.en:
After successfully completing the course, the students are able to:
  1. Increase their artistic expression, design skills, and conceptual thinking in the field of ceramics design;
  2. Execute independent studio work in model, mold, and prototype-making;
  3. Compare and evaluate the aesthetics and physical qualities of the material.

content.en:
The course is studio-based and includes the practical realization of an experimental art or design project in ceramics. The theme and standpoint changes yearly: from artifacts to surface design, from material research to exploring one´s artistic expression, and others. The assessment starts with gathering research material in pairs. The final brief is processed individually. It starts by sketching and presenting the concept ideas, proceeding to studio work, and resulting in the making of prototypes or material experiments from ceramics. The concept development, designing, readings, and evaluation are processed theoretically in project seminars, where ideas, working methods as well as chosen solutions are discussed. The module ends up with a small exhibition presenting the results.
Students write a learning log referring to the readings and lectures and reflecting those to their creative learning process.

assesmentMethods.en:
To pass the course, the student must participate in lectures and group activities (80%) and present the final artifact.
Evaluation criteria: activity during the course, reflection on theory through the learning log, the quality and finalization of the final artifact/project and the content of the final presentation, covering the artistic process.

workload.en:
9 cr - 243 hours. 80% attendance is required. 
  • Contact teaching including lectures, group discussions, assignments and presentations 70 h 
  • Independent work including literature study, writing assignments and studio/Lab work 142 h 
  • Personal reflection 30 h 
  • Course evaluation 1 h

learningOutcomes.en: After completing the course, students:• Have a deeper understanding of the experimental design process and the capability to see the advantages of it.• Have the ability to execute a complex experimental project from ideation to finalization and presentation.• Organize their creative process more efficiently and produce a broader array of ideas.• Have the basic skills to understand biodesign and work with living organisms

content.en: The course follows a pre-determined and changing topic or stakeholder that establishes the frame inside which the students work. In the first part of the course students will learn the basic methods and protocols to work with and for living agents. In the second part of the course students build on their earlier basic experimentations and tacit knowledge for collective and personal project outcomes.Throughout the course students are encouraged towards a process-led experimental approach, re-thinking about the possibilities, processes, and materials. Students are taught to see design practice and research from a biodesign process perspective. Students will conceptualize their creative work and learn how to translate process-led experiments into novel outcomes.

assesmentMethods.en: Documentation and content of background research, material design process, and hands-on experimentations both at the individual level and in the group context; quality of personal learning diary; visual and verbal communication skills. Passing the course requires attending 80% of the contact sessions: lectures, excursions, group meetings and feedback discussions.

workload.en:
Course workload 9 ECTS = 243 h. 80% attendance is required.
  • Contact teaching: 60 h
  • Independent studying: 150 h
  • Time to think: 32 h
  • Course evaluation: 1 h

learningOutcomes.en:
After successfully completing the course, the students are able to:
  1. Understand the characteristics of glass as a material, including its aesthetic and expressive quality;
  2. Implement critical thinking towards glass making;
  3. Carry out a creative process by relying on means of documentation, reflection and discussions;
  4. Produce the projects/artefact(s) and present the concept and process of making to others.

content.en:
Depending on the yearly changing theme, the course highlights process, artistic sensibilities or social and environmental responsibility incorporating design, sculpture, architecture and/or craft. Students refine their ability to think and communicate through a multifaceted medium and seek a personal approach to the material and its aesthetics.
 
The task is to approach glass and glass making from a critical point of view, challenging oneself to think about what glass making stands for in today's world - both for the student and in the wider societal context. The assessment starts from doing background research, sketching and presenting the concept ideas and then proceeding to hands-on studio work and resulting in the making of the actual piece(s) in glass. The concept development, designing and evaluation are shared, reflected and connected to wider theoretical discourse in project seminars.

assesmentMethods.en:
To pass the course, the student has to participate in lectures and group activity (80%) and present the final artefact(s). 
Evaluation criteria: documentation and content of background research, material design process and hands-on experimentations; quality of personal learning diary; visual and verbal communication skills.

workload.en:
Course workload 9 ECTS = 243 h
  • Contact teaching: lectures, site visits, group discussions, assignments and final presentation 70 h
  • Independent work: literature study, writing assignments, studio work in groups and individually 142 h
  • Personal reflection 30 h
  • Course evaluation 1 h

learningOutcomes.en:
After successfully completing this course, students are able to:
  • Understand the role of design in relation to an eco-systemic context; challenge material values, aesthetics and new/old crafting methods;
  • Find relevant information and incorporate it with their existing design skills into a group project;
  • Record and present the process and discoveries in a learning diary.

content.en:
We focus on our relationship to the eco-systems our materials derive from. We immerse ourselves in the environment, understand it with the help of science and reflect on our role as designers in the light of this experience.
 
In the course we explore, understand and work with eco-systems and organisms and materials we encounter. Depending on the annual topic, the course may be conducted in collaboration with a company or organization and include site visits. Students will focus their group work on the role of design within the eco-systems they encounter.
 
Keywords: experimental, critical, poetic, process-driven, material exploration

assesmentMethods.en:
Documentation and content of background research, material design process and hands-on experimentations; quality of personal learning diary; visual and verbal communication skills. Passing the course requires attending 80% of the contact sessions (lectures, excursions, group meetings and feedback discussions) and personal learning diary kept throughout the course.
Evaluation criteria: activity during the course, the creative process, quality of the final artefact and learning diary.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Basic knowledge of CAD/3D modeling & Adobe software.
prerequisites.sv: Suositellut esitiedot: Basic knowledge of CAD/3D modeling & Adobe software.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Basic knowledge of CAD/3D modeling & Adobe software.

learningOutcomes.en:
After successfully completing the course, the students are able to:
  • Identify different areas of digital design;
  • Experiment with, analyze & detect digital processes that offer novel possibilities;
  • Create new designs, processes, or expressions by using digital tools.

content.en: Digital design is a relatively new toolset, process and a medium. Therefore, there are a lot of possibilities for exploring the boundaries of digital design and one’s skillset. During the course, the student has a chance to learn about and explore the creative use of digital design. Every student carries out an explorative project in the area of digital design. After the course, the student has the possibility to continue the project as a personal project 2-10 cr.

assesmentMethods.en:
Students must attend and display active participation in at least 80% of the contact teachings (lectures, workshops, etc.). 
Creative use of digital design (uniqueness), technical mastery, significance in the field, process.

workload.en: Course workload 9 cr = 243 h. 80% attendance is required.Contact teaching 40 hIndividual work 154 hPersonal reflection 48 hCourse evaluation 1 h

prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Students should master the basics of 3D modelling. Previous experiences in model making and hands on prototyping is beneficial but not prerequisite.

learningOutcomes.en:
On successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
(1) elaborate product concepts of high aesthetic and stylistic appeal and sophistication and to create argumentation on their design
(2) identify the premises of form giving such as design strategy, brand positioning, trends, cultural differences in consumer preference and such not forgetting their personal insight
(3) specify and communicate the goals of visual design and they develop advanced skills in converting these premises to solutions that are expressed in 3-dimensional form.

content.en:
The course gives the students an opportunity to focus on form and aesthetics and deepen their skills. They learn to master a reflective process of visual design and build personal repertoire of visual design principles. The course gives the students advanced skills in form giving and the aesthetical design of physical products or artefacts. The course addresses a critical viewpoint of understanding dominant aesthetic conceptions and ways of perceiving products, designand form. Individual design processes and form giving is reflected against these perceptions. Students get to experiment with and perfect their skills with a range of visual manual and digital design tools and methods such as mood boarding, sketching, design drawing and computer aided design tools.
 
They become competent with contemporary techniques in design visualisation and they learn to justify their solutions visually and verbally. 
The focus of the course is mainly on design concept development and communicating developed concept further with the help of visual media such as sketching, drawing and rendered images.

assesmentMethods.en: The students on the course work in design studio mode elaborating their individual assignments under the super vision of the instructor(s). The elaboration is supported by lectures, excursions and literature assignments. Active participation in lectures, excursions and group activity, design assignments and personal reflection. Evaluation criteria: process/reflection, participation, concept development design/aesthetics, visualisations/renderings, general evaluation.

learningOutcomes.en:
On successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
(1) Master form giving and aesthetical design to be able to produce and manufacture physical design prototypes with high standards
(2) Understand the benefit of physical design prototype in comparison with digital design concept
(3) Estimate the resources needed for physical prototyping in product development

content.en: Students get to experiment with and perfect their skills with a range of physical materials and they get to know material workshop/studio practices to be able to explore and develop the form giving of physical products. The course contains the required workshop "driving license(s)", material workshops including related studio practices and prototyping. The students work in design studio mode and utilise different material workshops related to their design assignments under the supervision of the instructor(s).

assesmentMethods.en: Process, participation and activity, concept development, design/aesthetics, prototype, general evaluation.

workload.en:
Course workload 9 ECTS = 243 h 
  • Contact teaching: 70 h
  • Independent studying: 132 h
  • Time to think: 40 h
  • Course evaluation: 1 h

learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course, the student is able to:
  • Identify suitable ways to document their ideas, processes and outcomes;
  • Understand how creative processes proceed and coordinate their own creative process;
  • Translate their ideas into an artefact by using a variety of skills, tools, and materials;
  • Describe the process and reflect on its outcomes and meaningfulness in written format.

content.en:
The aim of the course is to provide a challenging environment for action, where the student is encouraged to explore his/her ideas related to a given theme with a brave and open-minded attitude. The main objectives of the course are 1) to nourish the creative process with material exploration and experiments with different techniques and 2) to support the self-managing of the creative process with documentation, reflection and discussions. Each year, the course has a special theme and starts with an excursion in Finland. The starting point of the course is an idea of a researching artist/designer with a capability to conceptualise the perceived phenomena and experience. To support the process, the students keep a working diary throughout the course. In the diary, the students reflect on the working process by sketching and writing. In addition, the students document the entire process by photographing, videotaping or with other recording media.
 
The students can utilise different studios when elaborating their individual tasks and producing their final artefact. This work is supported by tutoring sessions, shared discussions, lectures, excursions and literature assignments. The course consists pf three phases: (I) collecting information (excursions, lectures, literature); (II) processing and interpreting the collected data (working in studios, sharing the process in group sessions); and (III) presenting the interpretation (final artefact).

assesmentMethods.en: To pass the course, the student has to participate in the excursion, lectures and group activity (80%), and present the final artefact. After the course, the student has to deliver a learning diary. Evaluation criteria: activity during the course, the creative process, quality of the final artefact and learning diary.

  • Understand the different parts and components of buildings, structures and landscape designs
  • Have a basic understanding of tectonics in architecture
  • Can explain the essential effects of forces in architecture and landscape architecture

workload.fi: The course includes 2 hours per week of contact teaching and 2 hours of self-learning in the computer lab (with supervision) every other week. Additionally, the students are expected to invest additional 9 hours every week for self-study and assignment completion. The course takes place in one period and lasts for 6 weeks. Attendance of the course during contact hours is compulsory. In order to successfully finish the course, the students must complete and submit the assignment.

learningOutcomes.fi: Students will learn the basics of the 2D digital drawing workflow specifically adapted to architects, landscape architects and interior architects. They will learn the basics of 2D vector drawing using Rhino software and apply the skills to a drawing assignment within the course. At the end of the course the students will gain familiarity with the CAD software and gain confidence to continue developing their digital drawing and modeling skills further through design courses.

content.fi: Didactic goal of the course is to engage students with the digital tools they will use daily in their professional work in design offices. Rather than focus on the design task (which is the focus of design courses), the students are required to learn 2D vector drawing digital workflow and apply it as a storytelling device to a specific assignment. For this course students will use Rhino software due to its versatility and generic nature. The knowledge gained in this course can be easily expanded in student s further bachelor and master studies and the choice of software supports that. The course is not meant to be conclusive on this subject but covers the essentials of 2D vector drawing in a CAD environment and conveys all the skills necessary to complete the assignment. The assignment itself is strongly guided by the teaching staff and consists of producing one 2D vector drawing which exhibits student s observation and interpretation skills as well as basic familiarity with the CAD drawing software.

assesmentMethods.fi:
Students will be evaluated based on the submitted assignment at the end of the course. The submitted assignment needs to follow the assignment guidelines which will be clearly communicated in the task description together with reference examples at the beginning of the course. Evaluation criteria fall into three groups:
  1. Formal
  • student has at least 60 % attendance rate for contact hours
  • assignment is within assigned topic and scope
  • assignment is submitted on time for evaluation and in correct format
  1. Skill
  • assignment demonstrates student s ability to engage and work in an independent fashion in the digital design workflow shown in the class
  • assignment demonstrates that the student invested the designated amount of independent study hours to master the software and equipment used in the digital design workflow shown in the class
  1. Integration
  • assignment demonstrat

name.fi: Näyttely osana taiteellista työskentelyä, Ryhmä: maisema-arkkitehtuuri, sisustusarkkitehtuuri
name.sv: Utställning som en del av konstnärligt arbete, Föreläsning
name.en: Exhibition as part of artistic practice, Lecture

workload.fi:
Ohjattu itsenäinen taiteellinen työskentely (sis. näyttelyripustus) kahden erilaista asiantuntijuutta edustavan opettajan johdolla. Keskustelutilaisuudet ja loppukritiikki. 
42h kontakti + 39h itsenäinen työskentely / aikaa ajatella
workload.sv:
Väglett självständigt konstnärligt arbete (innehåller utställning installation) under ledning av lärare som företräder två olika konstområden. Diskussioner och kritik.
42 h kontaktundervisning, 39 h självständigt arbete / time to think
workload.en:
Guided independent artistic work (including exhibition intallation) under the guidance of two teachers with different expertise. Discussion sessions and final critique.  
42h contact teaching + 39h independent work / time to think

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: - ARTS-A0115 Taiteen nykykäytännöt: Studio A - ARTS-A0116 Taiteen nykykäytännöt: Studio BSuositellut esitiedot:
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: - ARTS-A0115 Taiteen nykykäytännöt: Studio A - ARTS-A0116 Taiteen nykykäytännöt: Studio B
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: - ARTS-A0115 Taiteen nykykäytännöt: Studio A - ARTS-A0116 Taiteen nykykäytännöt: Studio B

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Osaat suunnitella, aikatauluttaa ja toteuttaa taiteellisen teoksen ennalta määriteltyjen olosuhteiden, kuten työskentelyajan, näyttelytilan ja teeman perusteella itsenäisesti.  
  • Pystyt hahmottamaan, miten erilaiset taiteen esittämisen käytännöt määrittelevät taideteoksia ja luovat merkityksiä.  
  • Tulet tietoiseksi taiteen esittämiseen tarkoitettujen tilojen konventioista.
learningOutcomes.sv:
• Du kan självständigt planera, schemalägga och utföra konstnärligt verk på grundval av förutbestämda förhållanden såsom arbetstid, utställningsutrymme och tema.
  • Du har förståelsen för hur olika utställningspraxis definierar konstverk och skapar betydelser. 
  • Du bekantar dig med konventioner i utrymmen avsedda för utställning.
learningOutcomes.en:
• You will be able to plan, schedule, and create an artistic work independently based on pre-defined conditions such as working time, exhibition space, and theme.  
  • You will gain an understanding of how different exhibition practices define artworks and create meanings. 
  • You will also become familiar with the conventions related to spaces designated for art exhibitions.

content.fi: Kurssi luo puitteet tarkastella ja kokeilla, mitä näyttelyn tekeminen osana taiteellista työskentelyä voi tarkoittaa. Kurssin aikana opiskelijat suunnittelevat ja toteuttavat taideteoksen suhteessa annettuun työskentelyaikaan, näyttelytilaan ja teemaan. Kurssi perustuu ohjattuun itsenäiseen työskentelyyn ja kanssaopiskelijoiden vertaispalautteeseen. Kurssilla painotetaan jo opitun hyödyntämistä ja soveltamista sekä työskentelyprosessien jakamista osana itsenäistä taiteellista työskentelyä.
content.sv: I kursen kan studerande undersöka och experimentera vad kan det mena att göra en utställning som en del av konstnärligt arbete. Studerande planerar och skapar ett konstverk baserat på den givna arbetstiden, utställningsutrymmet och temat. Kursen bygger på väglett självständigt arbete och feedback från medstuderande. I kursen fokuserar man på att tillämpa och använda tidigare inlärda färdigheter samt dela arbetsprocesser som en del av konstnärligt arbete.
content.en: The course offers a framework for exploring and experimenting with making an exhibition as part of an artistic practice. Students will plan and create a work of art based on the given working time, exhibition space, and theme. The course is based on guided independent work and peer feedback from fellow students. The course will focus on applying previously learned skills and concepts, and sharing working processes.

assesmentMethods.fi:
Kurssin suorittaminen edellyttää 80 % läsnäoloa, teoksen toteuttamista ja sen esille laittamista sekä osallistumista loppukritiikkiin. Arvioinnin perusteena on opiskelijan itsenäinen taiteellinen työskentely sekä osallistuminen lähiopetukseen ja yhteisiin keskusteluihin. Arvioinnissa tarkastellaan seuraavia asioita: 
  • Oma-aloitteisuus ja aikataulussa pysyminen.  
  • Teoksen toteutus näyttelytilan ja teeman näkökulmasta.  
  • Osallistuminen henkilökohtaiseen ohjaukseen ja yhteisiin keskusteluihin, sis. ajatusten jakaminen, kuunteleminen ja tilan antaminen toisille.
assesmentMethods.sv:
För att kunna slutföra kursen krävs 80 % närvaro, skapa och ställa ut ett konstverk samt delta i kritik.  
Grunden för bedömningen är studerandens självständigt konstnärliga arbete, deltagande i kontaktundervisning or diskussioner. I utvärderingen granskar man följande: 
 -  Självständighet och utförande av de tilldelade uppgifterna inom tidsfristen 
-   Utförande av konstverk från utställningsutrymme och temas synvinkel 
-  Deltagande i personlig handledning och diskussion, s.a.s.  att dela med sig av sina tankar, att lyssna och att ge rum åt andra.
assesmentMethods.en:
Completion of the course requires 80% attendance, realisation and presentation of the work and participation in the final critique. The assessment will be based on the student's independent artistic work and participation in the classroom and in collective discussions. The assessment will cover the following aspects:  
  • Self-initiative and adherence to deadlines. 
  • Achievement of the work in terms of the exhibition space and theme. 
  • Participation in personal tutoring and joint discussions, including sharing ideas, listening and giving space to others.

name.fi: Ways of Making 2 - Constructing sculpture with wood and metal, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Ways of Making 2 - Constructing sculpture with wood and metal, Föreläsning
name.en: Ways of Making 2 - Constructing sculpture with wood and metal, Lecture

workload.fi: 3 weeks intensive course. Working on site. Students are expected to be present during all contact teaching (105 hrs), as well as to work independently (15 hrs). Thime to think is 42 h.
workload.sv: 3 weeks intensive course. Working on site. Students are expected to be present during all contact teaching (105 hrs), as well as to work independently (15 hrs). Thime to think is 42 h.
workload.en: 3 weeks intensive course. Working on site. Students are expected to be present during all contact teaching (105 hrs), as well as to work independently (15 hrs). Thime to think is 42 h.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Studio A, Studio B, Studio C or equivalent
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Studio A, Studio B, Studio C or equivalent
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Studio A, Studio B, Studio C or equivalent

learningOutcomes.fi: Through a creative project, the student will become familiar with construction techniques using wood, metal, and other materials. The student will be confident in using wood working and metal working machines.
learningOutcomes.sv: Through a creative project, the student will become familiar with construction techniques using wood, metal, and other materials. The student will be confident in using wood working and metal working machines.
learningOutcomes.en: Through a creative project, the student will become familiar with construction techniques using wood, metal, and other materials. The student will be confident in using wood working and metal working machines.

content.fi: Students will be introduced to wood materials, hand tools and wood working machines, and shown how to use them safely. Students will be introduced to metal working, in particular construction techniques using welding and other power tools and methods. Students will create a sculpture combining wood, metal and other materials using construction techniques.
content.sv: Students will be introduced to wood materials, hand tools and wood working machines, and shown how to use them safely. Students will be introduced to metal working, in particular construction techniques using welding and other power tools and methods. Students will create a sculpture combining wood, metal and other materials using construction techniques.
content.en: Students will be introduced to wood materials, hand tools and wood working machines, and shown how to use them safely. Students will be introduced to metal working, in particular construction techniques using welding and other power tools and methods. Students will create a sculpture combining wood, metal and other materials using construction techniques.

assesmentMethods.fi: Individual and small group discussion and critique. Active participation in classwork. Successful completion of own project.
assesmentMethods.sv: Individual and small group discussion and critique. Active participation in classwork. Successful completion of own project.
assesmentMethods.en: Individual and small group discussion and critique. Active participation in classwork. Successful completion of own project.

additionalInformation.fi:
Teaching Language: English Teaching Period: 2024-2025 Spring IV  2025-2026 Spring IV Registration: Minimum amount of participants is 8 students. Maximum amount of participants is 20 students.
Priority order to courses is according to the order of priority decided by the Academic committee for School of Arts, Design and Architecture https//www.aalto.fi/en/services/registering-to-courses-and-the-order-of-priority-in-aalto-arts. 
After the registration has closed, SISU conducts a raffle to allocate all the seats while considering the possible prioritisation order stated above. If there are more registrants than available seats, ten (10) students from the remaining applicants are drawn and placed on a waiting list in numerical order. On the first day of the course, these students may check for available seats in case of no-shows. Any available seats are then filled in numerical order. Students on the waiting list will receive an email containing details about the registration status, once the registration period has closed.

learningOutcomes.fi: After completing the course, the student is familiar with the different forms of comics and understands the impact of form in narration in the art of comics. The student will be able to use what they have learnt in their own visual and narrative expression.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The course enables the student to
  1. understand the benefits of digital modelling in fashion design and production
  2. understand the basics of digital modelling
  3. solve problems and utilize digital modelling in their own design process
  4. know how digital modelling is used in the fashion industries.
learningOutcomes.sv:

  2. understand the basics of digital modelling
  3. solve problems and utilize digital modelling in their own design process
  4. know how digital modelling is used in the fashion industries.
learningOutcomes.en:
The course enables the student to
  1. understand the benefits of digital modelling in fashion design and production
  2. understand the basics of digital modelling
  3. solve problems and utilize digital modelling in their own design process
  4. know how digital modelling is used in the fashion industries.

content.fi: The course provides possibilities in digital modelling in fashion industry. Course consists of lectures, seminars, examples and visitors. Students learn the basics of Clo3D software and how to make digital product prototypes. Exercises lead to a digital collection which will be displayed at the end of the course.

name.fi: Advanced Surfacing and Digital Sculpting, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Advanced Surfacing and Digital Sculpting, Föreläsning
name.en: Advanced Surfacing and Digital Sculpting, Lecture

workload.en:
Lectures, workshops, online material, readings, tutoring, individual work, final assignment, critique  Workload 6 cr = 162 hours
  • Guided studying 60 h
  • Independent studying 69 h
  • Internalisation and reflection 32 h
  • Giving course feedback 1 h

prerequisites.en: "Suunnittelun digitaaliset työkalut" or "Introductory Design Project" or corresponding basic knowhow of surface modeling (CAD).

learningOutcomes.en:
After completion of the course, student is able to:
  • evaluate surface quality
  • use advanced surface modeling tools & techniques
  • use digital sculpting as a tool for industrial design
  • design higher quality 3D surface models

content.en: The course provides an introduction to advanced surface modeling - what it means and takes to create high (surface) quality CAD models for product development. The course also introduces tools to incorporate digital sculpting to industrial design workflow.

assesmentMethods.en: Assignments (surface quality and complexity, use of tools, attendance & activity, process). 100% active attendance in class, of which 20% can be compensated with homework.

1. Joint sessions (lectures, presentation, activities) for all programme students;
2. Major-level seminars, independent and group work in smaller groups

learningOutcomes.en:
On successful completion of this course, students
  • know the thesis requirements and evaluation criteria.
  • will be able to apply knowledge and skills acquired previously to advance their thesis.
  • will be able to develop their argumentation, presentation and feedback skills in their peer environment.
  • will be able to contextualise their thesis work and process within a specific area of their professional field in arts, media and culture, or across other fields.

content.en:
This compulsory MA Art and Media joint course, the Art and Media Master’s Thesis Seminar, supports students in the development and on-time completion of their MA thesis through a series of lectures, assignments and tasks. 
In case of specific and exceptional circumstances (for example, a student is undertaking exchange studies abroad or is doing an internship in the autumn semester of their second year, etc.), there is the possibility to complete the course independently over period I, II and III. Contact the Art and Media Thesis Seminar responsible teachers to discuss independent completion of this course.

learningOutcomes.fi:
On successful completion of this course students will have
  • explored the contexts for and importance of storytelling for imagining more sustainable, more than human futures.
  • critically-analysed a series of modern narratives about humans and non humans.
  • experienced a series of ecological and multispecies narrative techniques drawn from contemporary art practice, film and literature
  • been exposed to extra linguistic, multi-sensorial forms of story telling
  • collaboratively experimented with and generated their own eco-narrative techniques.
  • created their own ecological story telling project.
  • critically and reflexively evaluated their own ecological story telling project and those of their peers.

On successful completion of this course students will have
  • explored the contexts for and importance of storytelling for imagining more sustainable, more than human futures.
  • critically-analysed a series of modern narratives about humans and non humans.
  • experienced a series of ecological and multispecies narrative techniques drawn from contemporary art practice, film and literature
  • been exposed to extra linguistic, multi-sensorial forms of story telling
  • collaboratively experimented with and generated their own eco-narrative techniques.
  • created their own ecological story telling project.
  • critically and reflexively evaluated their own ecological story telling project and those of their peers.
learningOutcomes.en:
On successful completion of this course students will have

  • critically-analysed a series of modern narratives about humans and non humans.
  • experienced a series of ecological and multispecies narrative techniques drawn from contemporary art practice, film and literature
  • been exposed to extra linguistic, multi-sensorial forms of story telling
  • collaboratively experimented with and generated their own eco-narrative techniques.
  • created their own ecological story telling project.
  • critically and reflexively evaluated their own ecological story telling project and those of their peers.

content.fi: In this course, you will critically consider the existing stories that humans tell ourselves about our relationships to non humans. You will explore a range of ecological and climate related narrative approaches, which aim, in different ways to displace a human centre of storytelling. You will apply these experiences and tools in the collaborative and experimental crafting of new, eco-related narrative

workload.fi:

Contact teaching 42h/ Other 120
Lectures 5-10h, Groupwork 60h, Workshop and practice-based work 44h, Independent reading and writing 12h, Reflection and thinking 25h.
Other 13h: Making individual reflections for final presentation.
This is a strongly practice-based course and will involve for example: lab-work, design, construction, digital toolsand potentially a bit of electronics - depending always on the yearly study event. Additionally, there are givencompulsory humanistic and scientific readings - as well as just few lectures.

learningOutcomes.fi:
On successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
  1. Have a good understanding of working in wet/biolab.
  2. Reflect on experimental and/or laboratory practices and their artistic context of the field of art & science.
  3. Make experiments and/or constructed prototypes that are discussed in relation to individual interests and further project plans.
learningOutcomes.sv:
On successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
  1. Have a good understanding of working in wet/biolab.
  2. Reflect on experimental and/or laboratory practices and their artistic context of the field of art & science.
  3. Make experiments and/or constructed prototypes that are discussed in relation to individual interests and further project plans.
learningOutcomes.en:
On successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
  1. Have a good understanding of working in wet/biolab.
  2. Reflect on experimental and/or laboratory practices and their artistic context of the field of art & science.
  3. Make experiments and/or constructed prototypes that are discussed in relation to individual interests and further project plans.

content.fi:
This course focuses on topics inherent for the field of art & science, such as: the emergence of hybrid ecology, modified organisms, artificial and biological life, enhanced humans, evolution, intelligence at large - among various others. This course will take experimentation from the ground up (understood widely from wet-lab and to physical computing and to artist studio) as a starting point for this strongly practice-based course.
Typically, laboratory is understood as a facility that provides controlled conditions in which scientific or technological research, experiments, and measurement may be performed. This definition leaves out artistic experiments, however, during the first decades of the 21st century increasing amounts of artists have begun entering scientific laboratories and using scientific methodologies in their work. Also, many artists consider their studio as a kind of a laboratory, a space for experimentations - systematic, messy and sometimes theoretical.
The course welcomes students from different disciplines with an interest in practice-based experimental artistic work, critical reflection and interest in the development of one's own practice in affiliation with art & science field.
It is recommended that students taking this course attend also the spring lecture-series course titled: Art & Science, which gives more grounding on the field of art & science at large.

name.sv: Föreläsningsserie om konst och vetenskap, Föreläsning

workload.en:
3 ECTS ≈ 81h
Contact teaching 18h / Other 63h
The course consists of lectures, provided readings and discussions.

learningOutcomes.en:
On successful completion of this course,
  • students have gained an in-depth understanding of a yearly focus topic from the field of art & science & technology.
  • students are able to reflect and contextualize their own practice and interests in relation to a yearly focus topic.
  • students have gained understanding of a relevance of transdisciplinary work and how art / artists can relate to scientific challenges, topics and issues.

content.en: The course is an in-depth lecture-series that is focused on topical issues and research that is relevant for the field crossing over art, science and technology. There will be a yearly changing focus/topic. The lectures within the course introduce topics from the sciences, interests of practitioners in art & science and art & technology – as well as conceptual, philosophical, societal and theoretical concerns related to these areas. The lecturers include external visitors and Aalto-based expert

assesmentMethods.en:
The evaluation is based on the participation, activity and oral examination, in which the students reflect their own practice, interests and research in relation to the topic, speakers perspectives and readings.
Minimum 80% attendance.
See MyCourses for more detailed information on evaluations methods and criteria.

workload.fi:
Course includes:
  • Participation in contact teaching sessions (at least 80% unless otherwise agreed) composed of lectures, discussions and small-scale in-class and take-home exercises.
  • Timely completion of assignments, individually and in groups.
  • Final reflective essay, presented in academic style and demonstrating familiarity with the course materials.
Overall workload is 6 ECTS = 162 hours:
  • 18h Teaching sessions
  • about 20h group work
  • about 80h Reading and 44h individual coursework including final essay, of which 10 - 20% "time to think".

learningOutcomes.fi:
After successful completion of the course, the student is able to:
  • Recognise and analyse values as integral to design discourse and practice, in general and in the sustainability context in particular;
  • Critically discuss key issues and debates relevant to values and design;
  • Identify and critically reflect on how technology and culture, including values and worldviews, are manifested in design in the context of the sustainability crisis;
  • Work with creative approaches that critique, develop and communicate diverse values in design.
In addition to these learning outcomes, students should be able to communicate creative as well as critical futures.

content.fi: The starting point for the course is that design is profoundly engaged in shaping society through ideas and visions of the future. Acknowledged or not, design involves judgements about what is desirable and for whom, and it requires working in contexts of potentially conflicting values. Through lectures, small-group seminars and exercises that involve reading, writing and visualising, the course prepares students to be more sensitive to the values, ethics and politics of design. It combines perspectives from several disciplines, including but not limited to design research, history, anthropology, sustainability science and science and technology studies (STS).

assesmentMethods.fi:
Grading scale 0 - 5 for independent work and pass-fail for groupwork, with successful students demonstrating the ability to:
  1. Thoughtfully identify and enquire into the values associated with sustainability and in relation to design, based on academic and other resources
  2. Critically analyse and evaluate relevant interventions as well academic debates concerning these
  3. Clearly articulate and neatly present (to academic standards) what has been learned
  4. Attendance and participation in teaching sessions and completion of all teaching assignments and exercises within deadlines given. Participation in the first session is mandatory.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Students who successfully complete this course should be able to:
  • Explain the basic constructs of critical and transformative futures;
  • Explore and critically evaluate various images of sustainable futures, including their own;
  • Propose and defend alternative images of sustainable futures based on research and creative imagination.

content.fi: The course introduces theories, tools and methods of critical and transformative futures with references to long-term, systemic change for sustainability. The conceptual constructs of the course are based on poststructural, decolonized, feminist and post-normal schools of futures studies. Through these conceptual tools, the students analyse images of futures produced by diverse actors in socio-ecological-technical systems critically, challenge their underlying assumptions and propose alternatives.

name.fi: Johdatus taiteelliseen työskentelyyn, Ryhmä: arkkitehtuuri, maisema-arkkitehtuuri, sisustusarkkitehtuuri

workload.fi:
Kontaktiopetus kahta eri taiteenalaa edustavan opettajan johdolla sekä itsenäinen työskentely. Havaitsemiseen ja kokemukseen perustuvat harjoitustyöt, jotka sisältävät kriittistä pohdintaa. Ohjattu työskentely opettajien antamien tehtävien pohjalta. Kritiikki- ja keskustelutilaisuudet. Harjoitustöissä vaihtelevat tekniikat.  
84 h kontaktiopetus, 78 h itsenäinen työskentely / aikaa ajatella
workload.sv:
Kontaktundervisning under ledning av lärare som företräder två olika konstområden samt självständigt  arbete. Uppgifter som bygger på perception och erfarenhet samt som innehåller kritiska reflektioner. 
Väglett arbete baserat på uppgifter som läraren har gett. Kritik och diskussion. Varierade tekniker I uppgifterna.   
84 h kontaktundervisning, 78 h självständigt arbete / time to think
workload.en:
Contact teaching under the guidance of teachers from two different fields of art, and independent work. Exercises based on observation and experience, which include critical reflection. Supervised work based on assignments given by teachers. Critique and discussion sessions. Varying techniques are used in the assignments. 
84 h contact teaching, 78 h independent work / time to think

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Tunnet taiteellisen työskentelyn perustekniikoita ja -käsitteitä.  
  • Osaat hyödyntää taiteellista työskentelyä ajattelun välineenä.  
  • Sinulla on valmiuksia uuden kokeiluun ja itsesi ilmaisemiseen.   
  • Sinulla on kyky pohtia ja keskustella omasta ja muiden taiteellisesta työskentelystä.  
  • Osaat hyödyntää taiteellisen työskentelyn menetelmiä omassa luovassa työssäsi.
learningOutcomes.sv:
• Du känner till grundläggande tekniker och begrepp för konstnärligt arbete. 
  • Du vet hur man använder  konstnärligt  arbete som ett sätt att tänka. 
  • Du har förmågan att  experimentera nya saker och uttrycka dig själv i det konstnärliga arbetet. 
  • Du har  förmågan  att  reflektera  och diskutera ditt eget  och andras konstnärliga arbete. 
  • Du kan metoder för konstnärligt arbete i  ditt eget kreativa arbete.
learningOutcomes.en:
• You are familiar with the basic techniques and concepts of artistic work. 
  • You are able to use artistic work as a tool for thinking. 
  • You have abilities to experiment and express yourself. 
  • You can reflect on and discuss your own and others' artistic work. 
  • You can apply artistic working methods in your own creative work.

content.fi: Kurssilla tutustutaan taiteen tekemiseen ajattelun välineenä. Menetelmänä on tekemällä oppiminen. Taiteellista työskentelyä lähestytään havaintoon, kokemukseen ja materiaalisuuteen perustuen sekä käsitteellisempien näkökulmien avulla. Työskentely on tehtävälähtöistä ja ohjattua. Käytännön tekemisen kautta tutustutaan taiteen ja muotoilun laajaan peruskäsitteistöön.  Kurssilla painotetaan keskustelua ja vuorovaikutusta vertaisryhmässä. Tehtävien avulla opiskelijoita kannustetaan haastamaan totuttuja tekemisen tapoja ja laajentamaan omia käsityksiä taiteesta.   Avainsanat: volyymi, mittasuhteet, muoto, tila, viiva, taso, massa, rytmi, tekstuuri, kuvio, aika, painovoima, väri, valo ja varjo.
content.sv: I kursen bekantar du dig med konstnärligt arbete som metod för tänkande.  Metoden är learning-by-doing (att lära genom att göra). Man närmar sig konstnärligt arbete med hjälp av perception, erfarenhet och materialitet samt mer konceptuella synvinklar. Arbetet är uppgiftsorienterat och väglett. Genom det praktiska arbetet lär man känna omfattande grundbegrepp inom konsten och  formgivningen.   I kursen fokuserar man på diskussion och interaktion i gruppen. Med hjälp av uppgifterna uppmuntras studerande att utmana vanliga sätt att göra saker och att bredda sina egna  uppfattningar om konst.   Nyckelord: volym, proportioner,  form, rum, linje, plan, massa, rytm, textur, mönster, tid, tyngdkraft, färg, ljus och skugga
content.en: The course introduces artmaking as a tool for thinking. The method is learning by doing. Artistic practices are approached through observation, experience, materiality as well as conceptual perspectives. Working is task-based and guided. Through practical work, students are introduced to broad, basic concepts of art and design.  The course emphasizes discussion and interaction with peers. Through assignments, students are encouraged to challenge their familiar ways of artmaking and to expand their own perceptions of art.  Keywords: volume, proportion, shape, space, line, plane, mass, rhythm, texture, pattern, time, gravity, colour, light, and shadow.

assesmentMethods.fi:
Arvioinnin perusteena on opiskelijan henkilökohtainen edistyminen, aktiivinen osallistuminen sekä kyky ilmaista ja hyödyntää oppimaansa. Arvioinnissa tarkastellaan seuraavia asioita:  
  • Oman sekä muiden taiteellisen työskentelyn ja oppimisprosessin pohdinta kurssilla opittuja käsitteitä hyödyntäen. 
  • Taiteellisen ajattelun ja ilmaisun kehittyminen.  
  • Valmius uuden kokeiluun. 
  • Osallistuminen keskusteluihin, sis. ajatusten jakaminen, kuunteleminen ja tilan antaminen toisille. 
  • Oma-aloitteisuus ja vastuullisuus ateljeetyöskentelyssä. 
Kurssin suorittaminen edellyttää 80 % läsnäoloa ja annettujen tehtävien toteuttamista opettajien antamaan määräaikaan mennessä.
assesmentMethods.sv:
Grunden för bedömningen är studerandens personliga framsteg, aktiva deltagande samt förmåga  att uttrycka  och använda det hen har lärt sig.   I utvärderingen granskar man följande: 
  • Begrundadet av studerandes egna och andras konstnärliga arbete och inlärningsprocessen med hjälp av begrepp som har lärts ut under kursen.  
  • Utveckling av konstnärligt tänkande och uttryck.  
  • Förmåga att experimentera nya saker. Att delta i diskussion, s.a.s.  att dela med sig av sina tankar, att lyssna och att ge rum åt andra.  
  • Självständighet och ansvar för ateljéarbete.  
För att kunna slutföra kursen krävs 80 % närvaro och utförande av de tilldelade uppgifterna inom den tidsfrist som anges av lärarna.
assesmentMethods.en:
Assessment is based on the student's personal progress, active participation, and ability to express and utilize what they have learned. The evaluation addresses the following issues:   
  • Reflection on one's own and others' artistic work and learning process using the concepts learned on the course.  
  • Development of artistic thinking and expression. 
  • Willingness to try new things. 
  • Participation in discussions, including sharing thoughts, listening, and giving space to others. 
  • Initiative and responsibility in studio work.  
Completion of the course requires 80% attendance and completion of the given assignments by the deadline set by the teachers.

workload.fi:
Kontaktiopetus kahta eri taiteenalaa edustavan opettajan johdolla sekä itsenäinen työskentely. Havaitsemiseen ja kokemukseen perustuvat harjoitustyöt, jotka sisältävät kriittistä pohdintaa. Ohjattu työskentely opettajien antamien tehtävien pohjalta. Kritiikki- ja keskustelutilaisuudet. Harjoitustöissä vaihtelevat tekniikat.  
84 h kontaktiopetus, 78 h itsenäinen työskentely / aikaa ajatella
workload.sv:
Kontaktundervisning under ledning av lärare som företräder två olika konstområden samt självständigt  arbete. Uppgifter som bygger på perception och erfarenhet samt som innehåller kritiska reflektioner. 
Väglett arbete baserat på uppgifter som läraren har gett. Kritik och diskussion. Varierade tekniker I uppgifterna.   
84 h kontaktundervisning, 78 h självständigt arbete / time to think
workload.en:
Contact teaching under the guidance of teachers from two different fields of art, and independent work. Exercises based on observation and experience, which include critical reflection. Supervised work based on assignments given by teachers. Critique and discussion sessions. Varying techniques are used in the assignments. 
84 h contact teaching, 78 h independent work / time to think

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Tunnet taiteellisen työskentelyn perustekniikoita ja -käsitteitä.  
  • Osaat hyödyntää taiteellista työskentelyä ajattelun välineenä.  
  • Sinulla on valmiuksia uuden kokeiluun ja itsesi ilmaisemiseen.   
  • Sinulla on kyky pohtia ja keskustella omasta ja muiden taiteellisesta työskentelystä.  
  • Osaat hyödyntää taiteellisen työskentelyn menetelmiä omassa luovassa työssäsi.
learningOutcomes.sv:
• Du känner till grundläggande tekniker och begrepp för konstnärligt arbete. 
  • Du vet hur man använder  konstnärligt  arbete som ett sätt att tänka. 
  • Du har förmågan att  experimentera nya saker och uttrycka dig själv i det konstnärliga arbetet. 
  • Du har  förmågan  att  reflektera  och diskutera ditt eget  och andras konstnärliga arbete. 
  • Du kan metoder för konstnärligt arbete i  ditt eget kreativa arbete.
learningOutcomes.en:
• You are familiar with the basic techniques and concepts of artistic work. 
  • You are able to use artistic work as a tool for thinking. 
  • You have abilities to experiment and express yourself. 
  • You can reflect on and discuss your own and others' artistic work. 
  • You can apply artistic working methods in your own creative work.

Registration:

content.fi: Kurssilla tutustutaan taiteen tekemiseen ajattelun välineenä. Menetelmänä on tekemällä oppiminen. Taiteellista työskentelyä lähestytään havaintoon, kokemukseen ja materiaalisuuteen perustuen sekä käsitteellisempien näkökulmien avulla. Työskentely on tehtävälähtöistä ja ohjattua. Käytännön tekemisen kautta tutustutaan taiteen ja muotoilun laajaan peruskäsitteistöön.  Kurssilla painotetaan keskustelua ja vuorovaikutusta vertaisryhmässä. Tehtävien avulla opiskelijoita kannustetaan haastamaan totuttuja tekemisen tapoja ja laajentamaan omia käsityksiä taiteesta.   Avainsanat: volyymi, mittasuhteet, muoto, tila, viiva, taso, massa, rytmi, tekstuuri, kuvio, aika, painovoima, väri, valo ja varjo.
content.sv: I kursen bekantar du dig med konstnärligt arbete som metod för tänkande.  Metoden är learning-by-doing (att lära genom att göra). Man närmar sig konstnärligt arbete med hjälp av perception, erfarenhet och materialitet samt mer konceptuella synvinklar. Arbetet är uppgiftsorienterat och väglett. Genom det praktiska arbetet lär man känna omfattande grundbegrepp inom konsten och  formgivningen.   I kursen fokuserar man på diskussion och interaktion i gruppen. Med hjälp av uppgifterna uppmuntras studerande att utmana vanliga sätt att göra saker och att bredda sina egna  uppfattningar om konst.   Nyckelord: volym, proportioner,  form, rum, linje, plan, massa, rytm, textur, mönster, tid, tyngdkraft, färg, ljus och skugga
content.en: The course introduces artmaking as a tool for thinking. The method is learning by doing. Artistic practices are approached through observation, experience, materiality as well as conceptual perspectives. Working is task-based and guided. Through practical work, students are introduced to broad, basic concepts of art and design.  The course emphasizes discussion and interaction with peers. Through assignments, students are encouraged to challenge their familiar ways of artmaking and to expand their own perceptions of art.  Keywords: volume, proportion, shape, space, line, plane, mass, rhythm, texture, pattern, time, gravity, colour, light, and shadow.

assesmentMethods.fi:
Arvioinnin perusteena on opiskelijan henkilökohtainen edistyminen, aktiivinen osallistuminen sekä kyky ilmaista ja hyödyntää oppimaansa. Arvioinnissa tarkastellaan seuraavia asioita:  
  • Oman sekä muiden taiteellisen työskentelyn ja oppimisprosessin pohdinta kurssilla opittuja käsitteitä hyödyntäen. 
  • Taiteellisen ajattelun ja ilmaisun kehittyminen.  
  • Valmius uuden kokeiluun. 
  • Osallistuminen keskusteluihin, sis. ajatusten jakaminen, kuunteleminen ja tilan antaminen toisille. 
  • Oma-aloitteisuus ja vastuullisuus ateljeetyöskentelyssä. 
Kurssin suorittaminen edellyttää 80 % läsnäoloa ja annettujen tehtävien toteuttamista opettajien antamaan määräaikaan mennessä.
assesmentMethods.sv:
Grunden för bedömningen är studerandens personliga framsteg, aktiva deltagande samt förmåga  att uttrycka  och använda det hen har lärt sig.   I utvärderingen granskar man följande: 
  • Begrundadet av studerandes egna och andras konstnärliga arbete och inlärningsprocessen med hjälp av begrepp som har lärts ut under kursen.  
  • Utveckling av konstnärligt tänkande och uttryck.  
  • Förmåga att experimentera nya saker. Att delta i diskussion, s.a.s.  att dela med sig av sina tankar, att lyssna och att ge rum åt andra.  
  • Självständighet och ansvar för ateljéarbete.  
För att kunna slutföra kursen krävs 80 % närvaro och utförande av de tilldelade uppgifterna inom den tidsfrist som anges av lärarna.
assesmentMethods.en:
Assessment is based on the student's personal progress, active participation, and ability to express and utilize what they have learned. The evaluation addresses the following issues:   
  • Reflection on one's own and others' artistic work and learning process using the concepts learned on the course.  
  • Development of artistic thinking and expression. 
  • Willingness to try new things. 
  • Participation in discussions, including sharing thoughts, listening, and giving space to others. 
  • Initiative and responsibility in studio work.  
Completion of the course requires 80% attendance and completion of the given assignments by the deadline set by the teachers.

name.fi: Johdatus taiteelliseen työskentelyyn, Ryhmä: muoti, muotoilu

workload.fi:
Kontaktiopetus kahta eri taiteenalaa edustavan opettajan johdolla sekä itsenäinen työskentely. Havaitsemiseen ja kokemukseen perustuvat harjoitustyöt, jotka sisältävät kriittistä pohdintaa. Ohjattu työskentely opettajien antamien tehtävien pohjalta. Kritiikki- ja keskustelutilaisuudet. Harjoitustöissä vaihtelevat tekniikat.  
84 h kontaktiopetus, 78 h itsenäinen työskentely / aikaa ajatella
workload.sv:
Kontaktundervisning under ledning av lärare som företräder två olika konstområden samt självständigt  arbete. Uppgifter som bygger på perception och erfarenhet samt som innehåller kritiska reflektioner. 
Väglett arbete baserat på uppgifter som läraren har gett. Kritik och diskussion. Varierade tekniker I uppgifterna.   
84 h kontaktundervisning, 78 h självständigt arbete / time to think
workload.en:
Contact teaching under the guidance of teachers from two different fields of art, and independent work. Exercises based on observation and experience, which include critical reflection. Supervised work based on assignments given by teachers. Critique and discussion sessions. Varying techniques are used in the assignments. 
84 h contact teaching, 78 h independent work / time to think

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Tunnet taiteellisen työskentelyn perustekniikoita ja -käsitteitä.  
  • Osaat hyödyntää taiteellista työskentelyä ajattelun välineenä.  
  • Sinulla on valmiuksia uuden kokeiluun ja itsesi ilmaisemiseen.   
  • Sinulla on kyky pohtia ja keskustella omasta ja muiden taiteellisesta työskentelystä.  
  • Osaat hyödyntää taiteellisen työskentelyn menetelmiä omassa luovassa työssäsi.
learningOutcomes.sv:
• Du känner till grundläggande tekniker och begrepp för konstnärligt arbete. 
  • Du vet hur man använder  konstnärligt  arbete som ett sätt att tänka. 
  • Du har förmågan att  experimentera nya saker och uttrycka dig själv i det konstnärliga arbetet. 
  • Du har  förmågan  att  reflektera  och diskutera ditt eget  och andras konstnärliga arbete. 
  • Du kan metoder för konstnärligt arbete i  ditt eget kreativa arbete.
learningOutcomes.en:
• You are familiar with the basic techniques and concepts of artistic work. 
  • You are able to use artistic work as a tool for thinking. 
  • You have abilities to experiment and express yourself. 
  • You can reflect on and discuss your own and others' artistic work. 
  • You can apply artistic working methods in your own creative work.

First year students in programmes/majors that include the course as compulsory. Students must attend the implemenation

content.fi: Kurssilla tutustutaan taiteen tekemiseen ajattelun välineenä. Menetelmänä on tekemällä oppiminen. Taiteellista työskentelyä lähestytään havaintoon, kokemukseen ja materiaalisuuteen perustuen sekä käsitteellisempien näkökulmien avulla. Työskentely on tehtävälähtöistä ja ohjattua. Käytännön tekemisen kautta tutustutaan taiteen ja muotoilun laajaan peruskäsitteistöön.  Kurssilla painotetaan keskustelua ja vuorovaikutusta vertaisryhmässä. Tehtävien avulla opiskelijoita kannustetaan haastamaan totuttuja tekemisen tapoja ja laajentamaan omia käsityksiä taiteesta.   Avainsanat: volyymi, mittasuhteet, muoto, tila, viiva, taso, massa, rytmi, tekstuuri, kuvio, aika, painovoima, väri, valo ja varjo.
content.sv: I kursen bekantar du dig med konstnärligt arbete som metod för tänkande.  Metoden är learning-by-doing (att lära genom att göra). Man närmar sig konstnärligt arbete med hjälp av perception, erfarenhet och materialitet samt mer konceptuella synvinklar. Arbetet är uppgiftsorienterat och väglett. Genom det praktiska arbetet lär man känna omfattande grundbegrepp inom konsten och  formgivningen.   I kursen fokuserar man på diskussion och interaktion i gruppen. Med hjälp av uppgifterna uppmuntras studerande att utmana vanliga sätt att göra saker och att bredda sina egna  uppfattningar om konst.   Nyckelord: volym, proportioner,  form, rum, linje, plan, massa, rytm, textur, mönster, tid, tyngdkraft, färg, ljus och skugga
content.en: The course introduces artmaking as a tool for thinking. The method is learning by doing. Artistic practices are approached through observation, experience, materiality as well as conceptual perspectives. Working is task-based and guided. Through practical work, students are introduced to broad, basic concepts of art and design.  The course emphasizes discussion and interaction with peers. Through assignments, students are encouraged to challenge their familiar ways of artmaking and to expand their own perceptions of art.  Keywords: volume, proportion, shape, space, line, plane, mass, rhythm, texture, pattern, time, gravity, colour, light, and shadow.

assesmentMethods.fi:
Arvioinnin perusteena on opiskelijan henkilökohtainen edistyminen, aktiivinen osallistuminen sekä kyky ilmaista ja hyödyntää oppimaansa. Arvioinnissa tarkastellaan seuraavia asioita:  
  • Oman sekä muiden taiteellisen työskentelyn ja oppimisprosessin pohdinta kurssilla opittuja käsitteitä hyödyntäen. 
  • Taiteellisen ajattelun ja ilmaisun kehittyminen.  
  • Valmius uuden kokeiluun. 
  • Osallistuminen keskusteluihin, sis. ajatusten jakaminen, kuunteleminen ja tilan antaminen toisille. 
  • Oma-aloitteisuus ja vastuullisuus ateljeetyöskentelyssä. 
Kurssin suorittaminen edellyttää 80 % läsnäoloa ja annettujen tehtävien toteuttamista opettajien antamaan määräaikaan mennessä.
assesmentMethods.sv:
Grunden för bedömningen är studerandens personliga framsteg, aktiva deltagande samt förmåga  att uttrycka  och använda det hen har lärt sig.   I utvärderingen granskar man följande: 
  • Begrundadet av studerandes egna och andras konstnärliga arbete och inlärningsprocessen med hjälp av begrepp som har lärts ut under kursen.  
  • Utveckling av konstnärligt tänkande och uttryck.  
  • Förmåga att experimentera nya saker. Att delta i diskussion, s.a.s.  att dela med sig av sina tankar, att lyssna och att ge rum åt andra.  
  • Självständighet och ansvar för ateljéarbete.  
För att kunna slutföra kursen krävs 80 % närvaro och utförande av de tilldelade uppgifterna inom den tidsfrist som anges av lärarna.
assesmentMethods.en:
Assessment is based on the student's personal progress, active participation, and ability to express and utilize what they have learned. The evaluation addresses the following issues:   
  • Reflection on one's own and others' artistic work and learning process using the concepts learned on the course.  
  • Development of artistic thinking and expression. 
  • Willingness to try new things. 
  • Participation in discussions, including sharing thoughts, listening, and giving space to others. 
  • Initiative and responsibility in studio work.  
Completion of the course requires 80% attendance and completion of the given assignments by the deadline set by the teachers.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssi tarjoaa opiskelijalle perustiedot ja -taidot sarjakuvan tekemisessä. Opiskelija saa ymmärryksen sarjakuvan tekoprosessin perusteista ja kykenee itsenäisesti tuottamaan sarjakuvan tarinoita. Opiskelija oppii käyttämään sarjakuvan teon työkaluja ja kirjoittamisen ja tarinankerronnan perusteita.
learningOutcomes.sv: Kursen erbjuder studenten baskunskaper och färdigheter i serieteckning. Studenten förstår arbetsprocessen i serieteckning och är kunnig att självständigt producera historier i serieteckning. Student lär sig att använda de vanliga verktygen i serieteckning, samt grunderna i skrivning och historieberättande.
learningOutcomes.en: The course provides the student with basic knowledge and skills in making comics. The student understands the working process of comics and is able to independently produce comics stories. The student learns to use common tools in comics, and basics of writing and storytelling.

content.fi: Sarjakuvan tekoprosessin vaiheet ja yleisesti käytetyt työkalut, nykysarjakuvaan tutustuminen, tarinankerronan työtavat. Edellytykset ja lähtökohdat kirjoittamiselle. Havainnoinnin tärkeys.
content.sv: Arbetsmetoder i serieteckningens process och de typiska verktygen, orientering samtida serieteckningskonsten, metoder i historieberättande. Förutsättningar och startpunkter för skrivande. Vikten av perception.
content.en: The working process of comics and typical working tools, orientations of contemporary comic art, methods of storytelling. Preconditions and premises of writing. The significance of perception.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssin ohjatut työskentelytavat, itsenäinen työskentely, ryhmäkeskustelut ja kritiikit. Teemaluennot ja sarjakuvataiteilijoitten esittelyt.
assesmentMethods.sv: De huvudsakliga arbetsmetoderna under kursen är väglett och självständigt arbete, grupp diskussioner och kritik. Tema föreläsningar och presentationer av konstnärer i serieteckning.
assesmentMethods.en: The main working methods during the course are guided and independent work, group discussions and critiques. Themed lectures and presentations of comic artists.

substitutes.en: Sarjakuvailmaisu IARTS-A0218 Basics of Comic Art

Tämän lisäksi kymmenen (10) opiskelijaa arvotaan ja asetetaan jonotuslistalle vuoronumerojärjestyksessä. Ensimmäisellä opetuskerralla jonotuslistalla olevat opiskelija voivat kysellä vapaita paikkoja kurssilta. Vapaat paikat täydennetään jonotusnumerojärjestyksessä.

  2.  Aalto ARTS studerande
Efter anmälningstiden har stängts genomför SISU en utlottning för att fördela platser med beaktande av prioriteringsordningen. The order of priority for admitting students :1. Students in the Comics Expression minor 2. Aalto ARTS students 
After the registration has closed, SISU conducts a raffle to allocate all the seats while considering the possible prioritisation order stated above. If there are more registrants than available seats, ten (10) students from the remaining applicants are drawn and placed on a waiting list in numerical order. On the first day of the course, these students may check for available seats in case of no-shows. Any available seats are then filled in numerical order.

name.sv: Introduktion i projektarbetet i serieteckning, Föreläsning

workload.fi: 28 h kontaktiopetusta, 53 h itsenäinen työskentely
workload.sv: 28 h kontaktundervisning, 53 h självständigt arbete
workload.en: 28 h contact teaching 53 h, independent work

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssi toimii johdantona ARTS-A0229 Sarjakuvan projektityö -kurssille. Harjoitustöiden ja keskustelun avulla opiskelija tutustuu taiteellisen työn prosessiin ja sen rajoittaviin tekijöihin. Opiskelija oppii aikatauluttamaan ja suunnittelemaan oman työnsä ja ymmärtää taiteen alan pääperiaatteet ja sen mahdollisuudet suhteessa heidän omaan tapaansa työskennellä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Kursen fungerar som en introduktion till ARTS-A0229 Projektarbete i serieteckning. Studenten bekantar sig med konstnärligt arbete och dess begränsande faktorer genom uppgifter och diskussioner. Studenten lär sig att schemalägga och planera sitt arbete och förstår principer av konstformen och dess möjligheter i relation med sitt eget sätt att arbeta.
learningOutcomes.en: The course works as an introduction to ARTS-A0229 Comics Project. Through exercises and discussions students familiarize with an artistic work process and the limiting factors of it. Students learn to schedule and plan their works and understand the principles of the art form and its possibilities in relation to their own ways of working.

content.fi: Päätyöskentelytavat kurssilla ovat ohjattu ja itsenäinen työskentely, ryhmäkeskustelut ja kritiikit. Työskentelyn alla olevista  projektitöistä keskustellaan perinpohjaisesti ryhmässä.
content.sv: De huvudsakliga arbetsmetoderna under kursen är väglett och självständigt arbete, grupp diskussioner och kritik. Projekten under arbete diskuteras grundligt i gruppen.
content.en: The main working method during the course is guided and independent work, group discussions and critiques. The projects under development discussed thoroughly with the group.

assesmentMethods.fi: Opiskelijan henkilökohtainen edistyminen työnsä aikatauluttamisessa ja suunnittelussa. Opiskelijan kyky ilmaista ja soveltaa oppimaansa heidän taiteellisessa työskentelyssään.
assesmentMethods.sv: Studentens personliga utveckling i att schemalägga och planera sitt arbete. Studentens skicklighet att uttrycka och tillämpa det hen har lärt sig i sin konstnärliga arbetsprocess.
assesmentMethods.en: The personal advancement of the student in schedule and plan their works. The students ability to express and utilise what they've learned in their artistic work process.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssi on tarkoitettu opiskelijoille, jotka haluavat syventää visuaalista ja kerronnallista ilmaisuaan sarjakuvan alalla. Opiskelija kehittää kykyjään työskennelläkseen sarjakuvataiteen alalla. Opiskelija saa projektityössään kokemusta taiteellisesta työprosessista ja ymmärtää sen edellytykset ja vaatimukset.
learningOutcomes.sv: Kursen är ämnad för studenter som vill fördjupa sitt egna visuella och narrativa uttryck genom serieteckning. Studenten utvecklar färdigheter i att arbeta inom fältet för serieteckning. Studenten får erfarenhet av olika steg inom projektarbetet i serieteckning och förstår krav och förutsättningar i konstnärlig arbetsprocess.
learningOutcomes.en: The course is for students who want to deepen their visual and narrative expression by creating a comic series. The student develops abilities to work in the field of comic art. The student gains experience in different steps of the comic art project and they understand the requirements and preconditions of the artistic working process.

Minimiosallistujamäärä 8 ja maximiosallistujamäärä 16 opiskelijaa.    
Ilmoittautumisen sulkeuduttua SISU arpoo osallistujat ottaen huomioon mahdollisen priorisointijärjestyksen. Tämän lisäksi kymmenen (10) opiskelijaa arvotaan ja asetetaan jonotuslistalle vuoronumerojärjestyksessä. Ensimmäisellä opetuskerralla jonotuslistalla olevat opiskelija voivat kysellä vapaita paikkoja kurssilta. Vapaat paikat täydennetään jonotusnumerojärjestyksessä.
additionalInformation.sv:
Undervisningsspråket: engelska Undervisningsperiod: 2024-2025 Vår III - V  2025-2026 Vår III - V Anmälan: Prioritetsordning: 1. Studerande i biämneshelhet i serieteckning 2. Studerande som har genomfört kursen ARTS-A0228 Introduktion i projektarbetet i serieteckning 3. Andra ARTS studenter.
Kursens minsta antal deltagare 8. Maxantal deltagare 16.    
Efter anmälningstiden har stängts genomför SISU en utlottning för att fördela platser med beaktande av prioriteringsordningen. Om det finns flera anmälda studerande än lediga platser, tio (10) extra studerande lottas ut och placeras på en väntelista i numerisk ordning. På kursens första dag kan dessa studerande fråga om lediga platser om det finns no-shows. Lediga platser fylls i numerisk ordning.
additionalInformation.en:
Teaching Language: English Teaching Period: 2024-2025 Spring III - V  2025-2026 Spring III - V Registration: Priority order: 1. Students in the Comics Expression minor 2. Students that have completed the course ARTS-A0228 Introduction to Comics Project 3. Other ARTS students 
Minimum amount of participants is 8 students. Maximum amount of participants is 16 students.  
After the registration has closed, SISU conducts a raffle to allocate all the seats while considering the possible prioritisation order stated above. If there are more registrants than available seats, ten (10) students from the remaining applicants are drawn and placed on a waiting list in numerical order. On the first day of the course, these students may check for available seats in case of no-shows. Any available seats are then filled in numerical order.

content.fi:
Kurssikokonaisuus rakentuu vuosittain vaihtuvan teeman tai ilmiön ympärille. Työskentely perustuu opiskelijan omasta praktiikasta kehkeytyvään taiteelliseen, pedagogiseen ja tutkimukselliseen ajatteluun.
Kuvataidekasvatuksen rihmastot -kurssi on taidetta, teoriaa, tekemistä. Vieraillen ja viipyillen. Tutkien, kokeillen ja jakaen. Kurssin puitteissa toteutetaan vuosittain määritelty tapahtuma tai tuotanto sekä valinnainen pedagoginen opintomatka.

workload.en:
6 ECTS ≈ 162h

Other 114h
Lectures, experimental and artistic work, reading and writing, group work.
Participation in the course. Minimum 80% attendance.
In exceptional cases independent assignments to be agreed separately with teacher in charge.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Tämän kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija:
  • Oppii ymmärtämään digitalisaation ja digitaalisuuden kulttuurillisia, taiteellisia,  yhteiskunnallisia, kasvatuksellisia ja yksilöllisiä vaikutuksia.
  • Oppii käyttämään erilaisia digitaalisen kasvatuksen malleja ja alustoja työssään.
  • Tutustuu ajankohtaisiin digitaalisuuden ja digitaalisen kulttuurin ilmiöihin, erityisesti kuvataidekasvatuksen kannalta
learningOutcomes.sv:
När studenten har avlagt kursen,
  • Lär sig förstå kulturella, konstnärliga, samhälleliga, pedagogiska och individuella påverkningar av digitalisering och digitalitet.
  • Lär sig använda olika modeller och plattformar för digital utbildning i sitt arbete.
  • Bekantar sig med aktuella fenomen inom digitalitet och digital kultur, särskilt med avseende på bildpedagogik
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon completing this course, the student:
  • Learns to understand the cultural, artistic, societal, educational, and individual impacts of digitalization and digitization.
  • Learns to use various models and platforms of digital education in their work.
  • Familiarizes themselves with current phenomena in digitality and digital culture, especially from the perspective of art education.

content.fi: Opiskelija ymmärtää digitaalisaation ja digitaalisuuden monitasoisia vaikutuksia yhteiskuntaan ja ihmisten elämään, erityisesti taiteeseen, kulttuuriin oppimiseen, opettamiseen ja koulutukseen.
content.sv: Studenten förstår digitaliseringens och digitalitetens mångfacetterade påverkan på samhället och människors liv, särskilt inom konst, kultur, lärande, undervisning och utbildning.
content.en: The student understands the multi-level impacts of digitalization and digitality on society and people's lives, especially in the areas of art, culture, learning, teaching, and education.

content.fi: Kurssilla opiskelijat suunnittelevat ja toteuttavat projektin opettajien antamien teemojen puitteissa. Opiskelijat asettavat itselleen tavoitteen ja dokumentoivat oman työskentelyprosessinsa.
content.sv: På kursen planerar och genomför studenterna ett projekt inom ramen för de teman som lärarna tillhandahåller. Studenterna sätter sina egna mål och dokumenterar sin arbetsprocess.
content.en: In the course, students plan and execute a project within the themes provided by the teachers. Students set their own goals and document their working process.

assesmentMethods.fi: Arvosteluasteikko 0–5. Arvostelun pohjana käytetään suoritettuja tehtäviä, aktiivisuutta sekä prosessin kuvausta oppimispäiväkirjassa.
assesmentMethods.sv: Betygsskala 0–5. Bedömningen grundar sig på utförda uppgifter, aktivitet samt beskrivningen av processen i lärandedagboken.
assesmentMethods.en: Grading scale 0–5. Assessment is based on completed assignments, activity, and the description of the process in the learning journal.

learningOutcomes.fi:
On successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
  • Understand and communicate the value of strategic design in responding to challenges of complexity;
  • Explore the opportunities and implications of how strategic design might help organizations operate more effectively;
  • Apply basic strategic design concepts in the furtherance of their other activities and interests.

learningOutcomes.en:
